newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit gains limited by KL corporate dlr buying.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit gains limited by KL corporate dlr buying.

text.p: Dollar buying by Kuala Lumpur-based corporates limited the ringgit's gains in afternoon trading, dealers said on Friday.
They said the ringgit was off the day's high and was expected to trade in a range in the near future.
"Heavy (dollar) selling from Japan started in the morning. Some U.S. funds also joined in," a dealer with a Singapore-based European bank said.
"But, there was (dollar) demand from KL commercials at 2.4925, which limited the dollar/ringgit downside," he said.
Dealers said Japanese funds were mainly investing in Singapore and Malaysia as hopes of an interest rate hike in Japan were fading.
One Singapore-based dealer said ringgit was expected to trade in the 2.4910/60 range in the near-term.
"The market is watching for trade, growth numbers this month and a possible savings bond issue," he said.
At 0900 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.4930/35 per dollar against 2.4948/58 at close of Kuala Lumpur on Thursday. The Singapore dollar was at 0.5654/60 per ringgit against 0.5649/55.
